user.title: Cable Modem Monitor
user.description: Enter your cable modem's IP address and credentials. The IP is typically 192.168.100.1 for Motorola modems. Leave username/password blank if your modem doesn't require authentication.

data_description.modem_choice: Select your modem model, or choose 'auto' to automatically detect it

error.cannot_connect: Failed to connect to the modem. Please verify: 1) IP address is correct (typically 192.168.100.1), 2) If modem requires authentication, enter username/password (leave blank if no auth needed), 3) Modem's web interface is accessible from Home Assistant's network. If your modem model is not supported, select 'Unknown Modem (Fallback Mode)' from the Modem Model dropdown to enable basic connectivity monitoring and HTML capture for future support.
error.unsupported_modem: Auto-detection could not identify your modem model. To proceed: Select 'Unknown Modem (Fallback Mode)' from the Modem Model dropdown below. This will enable basic connectivity monitoring (ping/HTTP latency) and provide a 'Capture HTML' button to help add full support for your modem. After installation, click 'Capture HTML' and download diagnostics to share with developers.
error.invalid_input: Invalid input provided. Please check the values and try again.
error.unknown: Unexpected error occurred. Check Home Assistant logs for details.

init.title: Cable Modem Monitor Settings

data_description.host: The IP address of your cable modem (typically 192.168.100.1 for Motorola modems)
data_description.username: Username for modem web interface (leave blank if not required)
data_description.password: Password for modem web interface (leave blank to keep existing password, or if not required)
data_description.modem_choice: Select your modem model, or choose 'auto' to automatically detect it. Change this if auto-detection isn't working correctly.
data_description.scan_interval: How often to poll the modem for data (60-1800 seconds). Default: 600 seconds (10 minutes). Lower values increase network traffic and may strain older modems.
